definition: to talk idly about important matters (idiom)/to set the world to rights/to pass judgment on everything
finger/to point at or to/to indicate or refer to/to depend on/to count on/(of hair) to stand on end

point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items
mountain/hill/anything that resembles a mountain/CL:座[zuo4]/bundled straw in which silkworms spin cocoons/gable

sentences.english: Who can show the country, take it leisurely and unoppressively?
sentences.chinese: 谁又能指点江山，从容不迫？

sentences.english: Are we all so unintelligent that we need an elitist to comment on national affairs?
sentences.chinese: 我们都是些低能儿，需要精英来指点江山？

sentences.english: Exactly schoolmate youth, in full flower, the direction landscape, encourages the writing.
sentences.chinese: 恰同学少年，风华正茂，指点江山，激扬文字。

sentences.english: There were only the passersby on the side watching the excitement and making comments.
sentences.chinese: 只有一帮闲人帮旁边看热闹指点江山。

sentences.english: We can proudly" Jiangshan guidance, stimulate raise character".
sentences.chinese: 我们可以自得地“指点江山，激扬文字”。

definition: lit. to devise battle plan in a tent (idiom)/fig. planning strategies
to be able to plan victory from a thousand miles away (idiom)
to sit and pontificate; to find answers through theory and not through practice (idiom)
to talk cheerfully and wittily/to joke together
to talk of the past and discuss the present (idiom)/to chat freely/to discuss everything
